articles.author: Enock Muchinjo
articles.title: Dean du Plessis: Blind cricket commentator now losing his hearing
articles.description: Du Plessis was born blind. He lost his father, his biggest fan, last year and is now losing his hearing.
articles.content: Harare, Zimbabwe Dean du Plessis was born blind. Forty-four years on, du Plessis says he is the worlds only blind cricket commentator and journalist and does not get tired of explaining how he is Zi… [+7315 chars]

articles.title: 'I don't fight the responsibility' - meet South Africa's cricketing history-maker
articles.description: Temba Bavuma has already made history by becoming South Africa captain. Now he is chasing more at the T20 World Cup.
articles.content:

articles.title: What we learned from watching the 1992 World Cup final in full again | ESPNcricinfo.com
articles.description: Wides, lbw calls, swing - plenty of things were different in white-ball cricket back then | ESPNcricinfo.com
articles.content: Last week, we at ESPNcricinfo did something we have been thinking of doing for eight years now: pretend-live ball-by-ball commentary for a classic cricket match. We knew the result, yes, but we tried… [+6823 chars]
